charge_type.source: Both defendants were jointly charged with one count of conspiracy to traffic in a dangerous drug... They pleaded guilty to the offence on 3 February this year before a magistrate and were committed to the High Court for sentence.

drugs.source: Upon search, the police found a paper wrapping containing two plastic bags containing a total of 42 grammes of a solid containing 31.4 grammes of cocaine narcotic. This is Exhibit E1.
A plastic recycling bag (Exhibit E2) containing 99 resealable plastic bags containing 89.866 kilogrammes of an unknown white powder (Exhibit E3) were also found inside the room.

role.source: Counsel submitted that his role was more like a courier taking the drug from the Lei Yue Mun Plaza back to the room.

mitigating_factors.source: As a result of checking or enquiry of that telephone number, they identified a certain person and eventually, about 152.26 grammes of cocaine was found at that person’s home... I am agreeable to give him a slight further discount for the information provided to the police. So he would be entitled to 36 per cent discount in total including his assistance and also his plea of guilty.

guilty_plea.source: They pleaded guilty to the offence on 3 February this year before a magistrate and were committed to the High Court for sentence.

starting_point.source: For 31.4 grammes of cocaine narcotics... the starting point would be one of 6 years and 7 months’ imprisonment.

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: For 31.4 grammes of cocaine narcotics... the starting point would be one of 6 years and 7 months’ imprisonment.

final_sentence.source: The resulting sentence for the 1st defendant is 4 years and 2 months’ imprisonment.

role.source: He had signed a tenancy agreement to rent the room... He admitted under caution that he had rented the room and he did not lock it, apparently for the purpose of allowing others to use it whenever they wanted. Apparently, his role was slightly more culpable than that of the 1st defendant.

aggravating_factors.source: He had signed a tenancy agreement to rent the room... apparently his role was slightly more culpable than that of the 1st defendant.

mitigating_factors.source: Counsel for the 2nd defendant... he has a long history of mental illness... I would take that into account as a matter of leniency and grant him a further discount of 1 month.

guilty_plea.source: They pleaded guilty to the offence on 3 February this year before a magistrate and were committed to the High Court for sentence.

starting_point.source: Having considered all the circumstances of the conspiracy, I consider the appropriate starting point for the 2nd defendant will be 6 years and 8 months’ imprisonment.

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: Having considered all the circumstances of the conspiracy, I consider the appropriate starting point for the 2nd defendant will be 6 years and 8 months’ imprisonment.

mitigation_reduction.source: I would take that into account as a matter of leniency and grant him a further discount of 1 month.

final_sentence.source: As such, he is entitled to the full one-third discount which reduce the sentence to 4 years and 5 months’ imprisonment... I grant him a further discount of 1 month. So the sentence in respect of the 2nd defendant is 4 years and 4 months’ imprisonment.
